title: Bug 5473 - ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces
description: Bug 5473 - ShiftLeft behavior with intermixed tabs and spaces Build 200110251.
OB:
When the tab character in the first line is replaced with spaces so that both lines are visually indented the same:

1. Execute ShiftLeft.

The text does not move as expected.

This behavior is confusing, as it is unclear why the text won't shift. Additionally, it is uncertain how the behavior is specified, but in the first scenario, it seems like the second line should be shifted left and the first line should be shifted at least to the space character, effectively removing the tab.

Presence of a stray space further adds to the confusion.
EB:
After replacing the tab character in the first line with spaces so that both lines are visually indented the same, executing ShiftLeft should shift the second line left and the first line should be shifted left at least to the space character, effectively removing the tab.

There should be no stray spaces causing confusion.
SR:
1. Replace the tab character in the first line with spaces so that both lines are visually indented the same.
2. Execute ShiftLeft.

Expected result: The second line should be shifted left and the first line should be shifted left at least to the space character, effectively removing the tab.

Note: Ensure that there are no stray spaces causing confusion.
